definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Don't take yourself too seriously; laugh at your slipups and faults.
sentences.chinese: 不要太過嚴肅，不妨對自己的過錯和缺點莞爾一笑。

sentences.english: He shot a smile at his wife.
She gave me a smile in exchange for my help.
sentences.chinese: 我幫了她一忙博得了她的莞爾一笑。

sentences.english: But she had only smiled a little and her eyes had admitted nothing.
sentences.chinese: 但她只是莞爾一笑，眼裏並沒有任何表示。

sentences.english: The Robert smiles to the Gordon and shocks his head and no longer speaks.
sentences.chinese: 羅柏特對高登莞爾一笑，搖了搖頭，不再吭聲。

sentences.english: Heck, it might even put a smile on the mail carrier's face.
sentences.chinese: 它甚至讓郵差莞爾一笑。

sentences.english: She smiles whenever she sees him.
sentences.chinese: 她每次見到他時就莞爾一笑。

definition: variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
(of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
to miss/to yearn day and night
hard to tell if it's real or sham
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
